attributes.action: Carers - more financial help while caring & when Caring finishes help into work
attributes.additional_details:
We are an ageing population, and as a result family members are now looking after their parents more now than ever before. 

As a result, those carers only receive a paltry £67.60 a week, which will often result in more than 35+ hours a week.

This should be significantly increased to improve the living standards of the carers, along with more importantly, those being cared for. 

After a lengthened period of time as a carer for a parent, following this there needs to be vastly more support for the carer to get back into work within society & finding employment.
attributes.background: Help Carers with their finances while caring and when Bereavement happens, help back into work

rejection.details:
We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Increase Carer's Allowance to equal 35 hours at the National Living Wage: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599102

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to create a fund to increase support for former carers to enter work, if that's something you'd like to happen.
